intro: Aethionema cardiophyllum var. edentulatum, commonly known as the heart-leaved rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive heart-shaped leaves. It produces yellow flowers in spring, which are followed by small, round pods containing seeds. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils.
